words.definition: To alleviate pain or suffering means to make it less intense or severe.
words.example: She needed something to alleviate the pain in her back.

words.definition: Astrology is the study of the stars in the belief that they influence people's lives.
words.example: Jack, who studies astrology, believes that the stars can predict the future.

words.definition: To differentiate things or people is to show the difference between them.
words.example: It was hard to differentiate between the identical twins.

words.definition: To disrupt something or someone is to prevent them from working.
words.example: The loud crash disrupted the class lecture.

words.definition: An equation is a math operation to determine the value of something.
words.example: I used the Pythagorean theorem to solve the equation.

words.definition: To err means to make a mistake.
words.example: The pilot erred in his estimate of the time it would take to make the trip.

words.definition: When something is erroneous, it is incorrect or only partly correct.
words.example: The child held the erroneous belief that time machines were real.

words.definition: If people or things are frantic, they behave in a wild way because they are frightened.
words.example: The cat became frantic when I tried to give it a bath.

words.definition: The hull of a boat or tank is the main body of it.
words.example: After the wreck at sea, the ship's hull was the last part to sink.

words.definition: When an action is inadvertent, it is done without realizing what you are doing.
words.example: She made an inadvertent error when she knocked over the nail polish.

words.definition: To improvise something is to do it with whatever is available or without planning.
words.example: There was no meat for the pizza, so we improvised with what was in the fridge.

words.definition: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.
words.example: The device was able to tell the traveler his exact latitude.

words.definition: A mariner is a sailor.
words.example: The old mariner used his telescope to find the shore.

words.definition: A multitude of things or people is a very large number of them.
words.example: A multitude of people were waiting at the airport.

words.definition: A nuisance is a person or thing that is annoying or causes a lot of problems.
words.example: The teenager considered her noisy little brothers to be quite a nuisance.

words.definition: The permanence of something is its ability to last forever.
words.example: Poor results will threaten the permanence of the new teaching system.

words.definition: To revolve around something is to keep it as the main feature or focus.
words.example: My life revolves around sports.

words.definition: To soothe means to calm someone who is angry or upset.
words.example: The mother soothed her crying baby by rocking him in her arms.

words.definition: If someone is stranded, they are prevented from leaving a place.
words.example: When the plane left, my sister and I were stranded in China.

words.definition: When something is volatile, it is likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly.
words.example: The volatile volcano might explode at any moment.
